title: The Literary Sources of the American Character: 1914-1956
description: The writers of the modern period and those of the early post-modern age, including writers marked by stylistic innovation and a willingness to challenge traditionally accepted standards. May include such writers as Hemingway, Fitzgerald, Stein, Hughes. 4 lectures. Crosslisted as ENGL/HNRSÂ 342. Fulfills GE C4 except for English majors. Fulfills GWR for students with junior standing (90 units).
prerequisites: Completion of GE Areas A and C1
